ygData.subject: RE:  3 questions
ygData.msgSnippet: I defeated Choon and Froon once at level 27 and again at level 29, both times using charm.  The second time was super easy since I had my brother s druid
ygData.messageBody:
I defeated Choon and Froon once at level 27 and again at level 29, both
times using charm. The second time was super easy since I had my brother's
druid snaring the one I wasn't charming, so when I switched to the winning
cyclops, it could catch the other easy. My only death using this method was
because I got a little sure of myself and tried to charm them in the rain
and Fog :-(.

Taneran Dreamweaver
<Clan Jax>
Bard of the 30th song
Prexus


> -----Original Message-----
> From: James Schuldes [mailto:jgs@...]
> Sent: Monday, December 06, 1999 10:35 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] 3 questions
>
>
> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> Greets!
>
> 1. Mistmoore - no clue. Mid 30's place afik.
>
> 2. Choon & Froon (gay clops?) live in West Karana on top of a hill with a
> really nice view of the Oger Camp (don't get near even though they con
> amiable - the Chief don't and he will harm touch for 400 and agro the rest
> onto you) and the strolling Hill Giants. If you enter West K from the NK
> near the river past the Stone Bridge, go about 1/3 of the way across the
> zone (hmm, kinda tough to judge if you are new to the zone) then go due
> North. Alternatively, you could follow the road thru north
> karana and enter
> west k on the road. Keep following it and stay out of the hills.
> Skirt the
> bottom of the hills (snarf the ghoul messenger boy, werewolfie, and any
> meandering HG's if you want) and look for a shop where Brenzl
> McManus sells
> his fletching goods (track Brenzl if you can). Right behind his shop - up
> on the hill Choon and Froon. Yes, if you work argo radius, you
> can pull em
> singles, I found that out when I tried to Lament and pulled a single.
> Fear-Chain-DoT-DD, rinse, repeat. I prefer to have a helper and SoW. I
> tried to charm one time and was resisted - but that was a couple
> levels back
> and maybe did not wear all my cha stuff. They are prolly low 30's - high
> 20's?
>
> 3. Freeport bards guild - the guy upstairs can train you in the basics
> of ID.
>
> Sylly
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Michal Hobson [mailto:given@...]
> Sent: Monday, December 06, 1999 9:55 AM
> To: EQBards
> Subject: [eqbards] 3 questions
>
> Hello all,
>
> I have a few questions this morning for everyone.
>
> 1) Which room in Mistmoore is the home of the gypsy lute
> dropping gypsies? How do I get there? Is there a secret way
> (i.e. through
> the secret room in the graveyard) which could be less hazardous to a group
> of around 30's? (I too share Shada's propensity for being lost - hehe. My
> train hotkey shouts "TRAIN TO......UM......Just watch out!")
> Once I get to
> said room, how difficult a place is it? 3 spawns, 4?
>
> 2) Where are Choon and Froon (I've spent the vast majority
> of my time on the East coast, so I'm not too familiar with the Karanas)?
> About what level are they? Is it possible to pull one without the other?
>
> And in another non-related vein:
>
> Can anyone please post or supply the web address to a
> comprehensive list of Bard skill caps? And once more, where do
> you have to
> go to train that first point in Instill Doubt?
>
> Thanks ahead of time for all the help,
>
> Weiland
> <Disciples of Truth>
> Erollisi Marr
>
>
